summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2019 between personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) and the FBI, coordinating the notification of victims in the Epstein case. The emails discuss updating victim contact information in the Victim Notification System (VNS), finalizing notification letters, and ensuring all victims are properly listed before a court conference.

persons.name: Justin
persons.context: Appears to be a Victim-Witness Assistant at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, responsible for managing the victim notification list and sending out letters.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Identified as the attorney representing certain victims in the Epstein case; his contact information is provided for notification purposes.

persons.name: Matt
persons.context: An Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) at the SDNY involved in the Epstein case, coordinating with the case agent and victim-witness staff on victim notifications.

connections.description: Work together at the U.S. Attorney's Office, with Matt (AUSA) requesting victim lists from Justin (Victim-Witness Assistant) and coordinating on notification letters.
Brad Edwards is identified as the attorney representing certain victims, requiring notifications to be sent to him.
Matt mentions reviewing the victim list with the case agent and planning to meet with them, indicating coordination between the prosecutor's office and the FBI.

events.title: Finalization of Victim Notification Letters
events.description: Emails discuss finalizing and sending out victim notification letters, with urgency noted due to an upcoming court conference.

events.title: Case Review Meeting
events.description: Matt plans to meet with the case agent on Monday to catch up on the case and review the victim notification list.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively managing victim notifications for the Epstein case in July-August 2019 using the Victim Notification System (VNS).
Attorney Brad Edwards is identified as representing certain victims, with his contact information being used for official notifications.
There was coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys, victim-witness staff, and FBI case agents to ensure accurate victim contact information and timely notification before a court conference.
The correspondence reveals a systematic process for identifying victims, correcting errors in victim information (like typos or attorney representation), and sending out legal notifications.
The emails show a sense of urgency, with staff working to finalize and send notifications quickly, particularly noted around July 26, 2019.
